1.text: Choose a spot with temperatures between 75–85 °F (24–29 °C).

2.text: Find an area with partial shade to plant your black pepper.

3.text: Install a trellis into the ground where you plant your black pepper.

4.text: Plant your black pepper plant in well-draining soil.

5.text: Soak your black pepper seeds for 24 hours before planting.

6.text: Dig a 1⁄4 inch (0.64 cm) deep hole in your soil.

7.text: Plant your black pepper seeds or cuttings 1–2 inches (2.5–5.1 cm) apart.

8.text: Start your black pepper seeds indoors if you live in a cold climate.

9.text: Water your plant 2 to 3 times per week.

10.text: Fertilize the pepper plant every 2 weeks.

11.text: Mulch your plant twice per year.

12.text: Spray insecticide on the plants to get rid of mealybugs or lace bugs.

13.text: Avoid overwatering your plant to prevent wilting.

14.text: Wait 2 to 3 years to harvest your pepper plant.

15.text: Harvest the peppercorn berries when they turn red.

16.text: Dry your peppercorns in the sun for 7 to 9 days.

17.text: Grind the peppercorns to make black pepper.

18.text: Store peppercorns in a dry, cool place for 4 years.
